verses.verse: And Jehovah <WH3068> said <WH559> unto Moses <WH4872>, Speak <WH559> unto the priests <WH3548>, the sons <WH1121> of Aaron <WH175>, and say <WH559> unto them <WH2930>, There shall none defile himself for the dead <WH5315> among his people <WH5971>;
except for his kin <WH7607>, that is near <WH7138> unto him <WH517>, for his mother, and for his father <WH1>, and for his son <WH1121>, and for his daughter <WH1323>, and for his brother <WH251>,
and for his sister <WH269> a virgin <WH1330>, that is near <WH7138> unto him <WH376>, that hath had no husband; for her may he defile himself <WH2930>.
He shall not defile <WH2930> himself <WH1167>, being a chief man among his people <WH5971>, to profane himself <WH2490>.

They shall not make <WH7139> baldness <WH7144> upon their head <WH7218>, neither shall they shave off <WH1548> the corner <WH6285> of their beard <WH2206>, nor make <WH8295> any cuttings <WH8296> in their flesh <WH1320>.

They shall be holy <WH6944> unto their God <WH430>, and not profane <WH2490> the name <WH8034> of their God <WH430>; for the offerings <WH801> of Jehovah <WH3068> made by fire <WH801>, the bread <WH3899> of their God <WH430>, they do offer <WH7126>: therefore they shall be holy <WH6918>.

They shall not take <WH3947> a woman <WH802> that is a harlot <WH2181>, or profane <WH2491>; neither shall they take <WH3947> a woman <WH802> put away <WH1644> from her husband <WH376>: for he is holy <WH6918> unto his God <WH430>.

Thou shalt sanctify <WH6942> him therefore <WH7126>; for he offereth the bread <WH3899> of thy God <WH430>: he shall be holy <WH6918> unto thee <WH3068>: for I Jehovah, who sanctify <WH6942> you <WH6918>, am holy.

And the daughter <WH1323> of any <WH376> priest <WH3548>, if she profane <WH2490> herself by playing the harlot <WH2181>, she profaneth <WH2490> her father <WH1>: she shall be burnt <WH8313> with fire <WH784>.

And he that is the high <WH1419> priest <WH3548> among his brethren <WH251>, upon whose head <WH7218> the anointing <WH4888> oil <WH8081> is poured <WH3332>, and that is consecrated <WH4390> to put <WH3847> on the garments <WH899>, shall not let the hair of his head <WH7218> go loose <WH6544>, nor rend <WH6533> his clothes <WH899>;
neither shall he go in <WH935> to any dead <WH4191> body <WH5315>, nor defile <WH2930> himself for his father <WH1>, or for his mother <WH517>;

neither shall he go out <WH3318> of the sanctuary <WH4720>, nor profane <WH2490> the sanctuary <WH4720> of his God <WH430>; for the crown <WH5145> of the anointing <WH4888> oil <WH8081> of his God <WH430> is upon him <WH3068>: I am Jehovah.
And he shall take <WH3947> a wife <WH802> in her virginity <WH1331>.

A widow <WH490>, or one divorced <WH2491>, or a profane woman <WH1644>, a harlot <WH2181>, these shall he not take <WH3947>: but a virgin <WH1330> of his own people <WH5971> shall he take <WH3947> to wife <WH802>.
And he shall not profane <WH2490> his seed <WH2233> among his people <WH5971>: for I am Jehovah <WH3068> who sanctifieth him <WH6942>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> spake <WH1696> unto Moses <WH4872>, saying <WH559>,

Speak <WH1696> unto Aaron <WH175>, saying <WH559>, Whosoever <WH376> he be of thy seed <WH2233> throughout their generations <WH1755> that hath a blemish <WH3971>, let him not approach <WH7126> to offer <WH7126> the bread <WH3899> of his God <WH430>.

For whatsoever man <WH376> he be that hath a blemish <WH3971>, he shall not approach <WH7126>: a blind <WH5787> man <WH376>, or a lame <WH6455>, or he that hath a flat nose <WH2763>, or anything superfluous <WH8311>,
or a man <WH376> that is broken-footed <WH7667>, or broken-handed <WH7667>,
or crook-backed <WH1384>, or a dwarf <WH1851>, or that hath a blemish <WH8400> in his eye <WH5869>, or is scurvy <WH1618>, or scabbed <WH3217>, or hath his stones <WH810> broken <WH4790>;

no man <WH376> of the seed <WH2233> of Aaron <WH175> the priest <WH3548>, that hath a blemish <WH3971>, shall come nigh <WH5066> to offer <WH7126> the offerings <WH801> of Jehovah <WH3068> made by fire <WH801>: he hath a blemish <WH3971>; he shall not come nigh <WH5066> to offer <WH7126> the bread <WH3899> of his God <WH430>.
He shall eat <WH398> the bread <WH3899> of his God <WH430>, both of the most <WH6944> holy <WH6944>, and of the holy <WH6944>:

only he shall not go in <WH935> unto the veil <WH6532>, nor come nigh <WH5066> unto the altar <WH4196>, because he hath a blemish <WH3971>; that he profane <WH2490> not my sanctuaries <WH4720>: for I am Jehovah <WH3068> who sanctifieth them <WH6942>.
So Moses <WH4872> spake <WH1696> unto Aaron <WH175>, and to his sons <WH1121>, and unto all the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>.
